title: MULPS â€” Multiply Packed Single-Precision Floating-Point Values

fields.name: Instruction Modes
fields.value:
`MULPS xmm1, xmm2/m128`
`VMULPS xmm1,xmm2, xmm3/m128`
`VMULPS ymm1, ymm2, ymm3/m256`
`VMULPS xmm1 {k1}{z}, xmm2, xmm3/m128/m32bcst`
`VMULPS ymm1 {k1}{z}, ymm2, ymm3/m256/m32bcst`
`VMULPS zmm1 {k1}{z}, zmm2, zmm3/m512/m32bcst {er}`

fields.name: Description
fields.value: Multiply the packed single-precision floating-point values from the first source operand with the corresponding values in the second source operand, and stores the packed double-precision floating-point results in the destination operand.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: EVEX encoded versions: The first source operand (the second operand) is a ZMM/YMM/XMM register. The second source operand can be a ZMM/YMM/XMM register, a 512/256/128-bit memory location or a 512/256/128-bit vector broadcasted from a 32-bit memory location. The destination operand is a ZMM/YMM/XMM register conditionally updated with writemask k1.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: VEX.256 encoded version: The first source operand is a YMM register. The second source operand can be a YMM register or a 256-bit memory location. The destination operand is a YMM register. Bits (MAXVL-1:256) of the corresponding destination ZMM register are zeroed.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: VEX.128 encoded version: The first source operand is a XMM register. The second source operand can be a XMM register or a 128-bit memory location. The destination operand is a XMM register. The upper bits (MAXVL-1:128) of the destination YMM register destination are zeroed.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: 128-bit Legacy SSE version: The second source can be an XMM register or an 128-bit memory location. The destination is not distinct from the first source XMM register and the upper bits (MAXVL-1:128) of the corresponding ZMM register destination are unmodified.

footer.text: Thanks to Felix Cloutier for the online x86 reference
